sentences.english: a kitchen chair
sentences.chinese: 厨房椅

sentences.english: They bought a new table and chairs.
sentences.chinese: 他们买了一套新的桌椅。

sentences.english: One of the chair legs was broken.
sentences.chinese: 椅子有一条腿断了。

sentences.english: Address your questions to the chair, please.
sentences.chinese: 请向主席提出你的问题。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of furniture for one person to sit on, which has a back, a seat, and four legs

sentences.english: Marie was sitting at her desk.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽正坐在书桌前。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of furniture like a table, usually with drawers in it, that you sit at to write and work

sentences.english: He chalked out a design on the blackboard.
sentences.chinese: 他用粉笔在黑板上勾划出一个图样。

sentences.english: She rubbed the exercises off the blackboard after class.
sentences.chinese: 下课后她把习题从黑板上擦掉。

sentences.english: The teacher knocked on the blackboard to catch our attention.
sentences.chinese: 老师敲了敲黑板以引起我们的注意。

detailed_translations.english: a board with a dark smooth surface, used in schools for writing on with  chalk

sentences.english: I wanted to punch him on the nose.
sentences.chinese: 我真想一拳打到他鼻子上。

sentences.english: Matt kissed her on the cheek.
sentences.chinese: 马特亲吻了她的脸颊。

detailed_translations.english: used to say what part of someone or something is hit or touched

sentences.english: These toys are not suitable for children under five.
sentences.chinese: 这些玩具不适合五岁以下的儿童玩。

sentences.english: Most of the events listed cost under £60.
sentences.chinese: 所列活动项目的花费大多低于 60 英镑。

sentences.english: I spend just under four hours a day seeing customers.
sentences.chinese: 我一天接待客户所花的时间将近四小时。

sentences.english: He took a deep breath before he went under.
sentences.chinese: 他在钻下水前深深地吸了口气。

detailed_translations.english: less than a particular number, amount, age, or price
Under is also an adverb

sentences.english: There’s some sugar in the cupboard.
sentences.chinese: 碗橱里有一些糖。

sentences.english: My mother was in the kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 我母亲在厨房里。

sentences.english: He took us for a drive in his new car.
sentences.chinese: 他开着他的新车载我们去兜风。

sentences.english: I found her sitting up in bed.
sentences.chinese: 我发现她直直地坐在床上。

sentences.english: Manson spent fifteen years in prison.
sentences.chinese: 曼森在监狱里待了15年。

sentences.english: a hole in the ground
sentences.chinese: 地上的一个洞

sentences.english: Mr Fisher is in Boston this week.
sentences.chinese: 费希尔先生本周在波士顿。

sentences.english: My parents live in New Zealand now.
sentences.chinese: 我父母现住在新西兰。

sentences.english: I never went in pubs.
sentences.chinese: 我从不进酒吧。

detailed_translations.english: used with the name of a container, place, or area to say where someone or something is

sentences.english: Where are you going?
sentences.chinese: 你要到哪儿去？

sentences.english: Where do they live?
sentences.chinese: 他们住在哪里？

sentences.english: Do you know where my glasses are?
sentences.chinese: 你知道我的眼镜在哪儿吗？

sentences.english: Where would you like to sit?
sentences.chinese: 你想坐在哪里？

detailed_translations.english: in or to which place

name: the
trans: 放在名词前，特指人、事或物

sentences.english: He described the scene to me.
sentences.chinese: 他向我描述了那个情景。

sentences.english: He telegraphed me to go to the party.
sentences.chinese: 他发电报要我去参加那个聚会。

sentences.english: The world exists, whether you like it or not.
sentences.chinese: 不管你喜欢与否，这个世界照样存在。

detailed_translations.chinese: 更加（用于比较级，最高级前）
detailed_translations.english: used before two  comparative  adjectives or adverbs to show that the degree of one event or situation is related to the degree of another one

sentences.english: You can carry this bag – it’s fairly light.
sentences.chinese: 你可以拿这个袋子——它很轻。

sentences.english: You should wear light, comfortable shoes.
sentences.chinese: 你应该穿轻便舒适的鞋子。

sentences.english: The truck was quite light and easy to drive.
sentences.chinese: 这辆卡车很轻，容易驾驶。

sentences.english: people who have suffered only light exposure to radiation
sentences.chinese: 只受到轻度辐射的人

detailed_translations.english: not very heavy

sentences.english: You should go to bed early.
sentences.chinese: 你应该早点上床。

sentences.english: She got into bed and turned out the light.
sentences.chinese: 她上了床，关掉灯。

sentences.english: rose beds
sentences.chinese: 玫瑰花坛

sentences.english: the sea bed
sentences.chinese: 海底

detailed_translations.english: a piece of furniture that you sleep on

sentences.english: Could you open the door for me?
sentences.chinese: 请你帮我开门好吗？

sentences.english: The door flew open and Ruth stormed in.
sentences.chinese: 门一下子打开了，露丝气冲冲地跑了进来。

sentences.english: Don’t forget to lock the garage door.
sentences.chinese: 别忘了把车库的门锁上。

sentences.english: Marc appeared through a door at the far end of the room.
sentences.chinese: 马克从房间另一端的门口出现。

sentences.english: the family that lives three doors up from us
sentences.chinese: 住在与我们相隔三户的那户人家

detailed_translations.english: a piece of wood, glass, etc. that is opened and closed so that people can get in and out of a room, building, car, etc.; a similar thing in a cupboard/closet

sentences.english: the jury box
sentences.chinese: 陪审团席

detailed_translations.english: a small area of a theatre or court that is separate from where other people are sitting

sentences.english: They live near London.
sentences.chinese: 他们住在伦敦附近。

sentences.english: I’m sure they live somewhere near here.
sentences.chinese: 我肯定他们就住在这附近。

sentences.english: They moved house to be nearer the school.
sentences.chinese: 他们把家搬到离学校近一些。

sentences.english: She told the children not to go near the canal.
sentences.chinese: 她告诉孩子们不要走近运河。

sentences.english: I’m warning you - don’t come any nearer!
sentences.chinese: 我警告你别再靠近！

sentences.english: We heard voices as we drew near the village.
sentences.chinese: 我们走近村子时听见了说话声。

detailed_translations.english: only a short distance from a person or thing
only a short distance away from someone or something

sentences.english: I turned to speak to the person standing behind me.
sentences.chinese: 我转身和站在我后面的那人说话。

sentences.english: Someone could easily creep up behind us.
sentences.chinese: 很可能有人跟在我们后面。

sentences.english: The car behind was hooting impatiently.
sentences.chinese: 后面那辆车不耐烦地按着喇叭。

sentences.english: Jane shut the door behind her.
sentences.chinese: 简随手关上身后的门。

sentences.english: The manager was sitting behind a large desk.
sentences.chinese: 经理坐在一张大办公桌的后面。

detailed_translations.english: at or towards the back of a thing or person

sentences.english: It is a big airline with a large fleet of planes.
sentences.chinese: 这是一家大航空公司，拥有庞大的机群。

sentences.english: It’s much quicker to go by plane.
sentences.chinese: 乘飞机去会快很多。

sentences.english: She slept on the plane.
sentences.chinese: 她在飞机上睡着了。

detailed_translations.english: a vehicle that flies in the air and has wings and at least one engine

sentences.english: a tennis/golf/cricket etc ball
sentences.chinese: 网球/高尔夫球/板球等

sentences.english: Shape the dough into balls
sentences.chinese: 把面团搓成丸子。

sentences.english: The air of the ball began to hum.
sentences.chinese: 舞会的气氛开始活跃起来了。

detailed_translations.english: a round object that is thrown, kicked, or hit in a game or sport

sentences.english: a small wooden doll
sentences.chinese: 一个小木玩偶

detailed_translations.chinese: 洋娃娃；玩偶；无头脑的美丽女人
detailed_translations.english: a child’s toy that looks like a small person or baby

sentences.english: We went all the way to Inverness by train.
sentences.chinese: 我们一路坐火车到因弗内斯。

detailed_translations.english: a set of several carriages that are connected to each other and pulled along a railway line by an engine
to teach someone the skills of a particular job or activity, or to be taught these skills

sentences.english: Dan got out of the car and locked the door.
sentences.chinese: 丹下了车，锁上车门。

sentences.english: He isn’t old enough to drive a car.
sentences.chinese: 他还未到可以开车的年龄。

sentences.english: Coughlan was killed in a car accident.
sentences.chinese: 科赫兰死于一场车祸。

detailed_translations.english: a vehicle with four wheels and an engine, that can carry a small number of passengers

sentences.english: a mother bear and her cubs
sentences.chinese: 母熊和它的熊崽们

detailed_translations.english: a large strong animal with thick fur, that eats flesh, fruit, and insects

sentences.english: ...fruits and vegetables that will be canned, skinned, diced, or otherwise processed.
sentences.chinese: …将要经过装罐、去皮、切块或其他加工程序的水果和蔬菜。

detailed_translations.english: When food or drink is canned, it is put into a metal container and sealed so that it will remain fresh.

sentences.english: ‘That’s Sarah’s cousin.’ ‘Are you sure?’
sentences.chinese: “那是萨拉的表妹。”“你肯定吗？”

sentences.english: ‘What time does the show start?’ ‘I’m not sure.’
sentences.chinese: “表演什么时候开始？”“我说不准。”

sentences.english: My mother, I felt sure , had not met him before.
sentences.chinese: 我敢肯定我妈妈以前从未见过他。

detailed_translations.english: confident that you know something or that something is true or correct
used to say ‘yes’ to someone

sentences.english: She was very sorry about all the trouble she'd caused.
sentences.chinese: 她对自己造成的麻烦感到很内疚。

detailed_translations.chinese: 遗憾的；对不起的，抱歉的
detailed_translations.english: feeling ashamed or unhappy about something bad you have done

detailed_translations.chinese: 对不起，抱歉（表示委婉的拒绝等）

sentences.english: a tasty sauce served with rice or pasta
sentences.chinese: 配米饭或意面的美味酱汁

sentences.english: a plate of brown rice
sentences.chinese: 一盘糙米饭

sentences.english: Serve with plain boiled rice .
sentences.chinese: 配白米饭一起上桌。

sentences.english: a few grains of rice
sentences.chinese: 几粒大米

detailed_translations.english: a food that consists of small white or brown grains that you boil in water until they become soft enough to eat

sentences.english: Do you like rice or noodles?
sentences.chinese: 你喜欢米饭还是面条？

sentences.english: They like to eat hamburgers, pizza and sandwiches but we always eat rice, congee, and noodles.
sentences.chinese: 他们喜欢吃汉堡包，比萨饼和三明治，但是我们总是吃米饭，稀粥和面条。

sentences.english: Have you ever eaten noodles before?
sentences.chinese: 你以前吃过面条吗？

detailed_translations.english: Noodles are long, thin strips of pasta. They are used especially in Chinese and Italian cooking.

sentences.english: fresh fruit and vegetables
sentences.chinese: 新鲜果蔬

sentences.english: organic methods of growing vegetables
sentences.chinese: 蔬菜的有机种植方法

sentences.english: vegetable soup
sentences.chinese: 蔬菜汤

sentences.english: a neat vegetable garden
sentences.chinese: 整洁的菜园

sentences.english: Vitamin A is found in liver and green vegetables.
sentences.chinese: 动物肝脏和绿色蔬菜中含有维生素A。

detailed_translations.english: a plant that is eaten raw or cooked, such as a cabbage, a carrot, or peas
relating to plants in general, rather than animals or things that are not living

sentences.english: Over 1,500 different species of fish inhabit the waters around the reef.
sentences.chinese: 那片礁石周围的水域生活着1,500多种不同的鱼类。

sentences.english: The stonefish is the most deadly of all fishes.
sentences.chinese: 石鱼是所有鱼类中毒性最强的。

sentences.english: You usually drinks white wine with fish.
sentences.chinese: 白葡萄酒一般配鱼喝

sentences.english: Dad really loves to fish.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸很喜欢钓鱼。

detailed_translations.english: an animal that lives in water, and uses its fins and tail to swim
to try to catch fish

sentences.english: Lionel built a coop so that they could raise chickens and have a supply of fresh eggs.
sentences.chinese: 莱昂内尔搭建了一个鸡笼，这样他们就可以养鸡，得到新鲜鸡蛋。

sentences.english: roast chicken
sentences.chinese: 烤鸡

detailed_translations.english: a common farm bird that is kept for its meat and eggs

sentences.english: Blackbirds lay their eggs in March.
sentences.chinese: 乌鸫在3月产蛋。

sentences.english: an ostrich egg
sentences.chinese: 鸵鸟蛋

sentences.english: The eggs hatch (= break open to allow the baby out ) in 26 days.
sentences.chinese: 这些蛋要26天才能孵化。

sentences.english: Joe always has bacon and egg for breakfast.
sentences.chinese: 乔早餐总是吃熏肉加蛋。

detailed_translations.english: a round object with a hard surface, that contains a baby bird, snake, insect etc and which is produced by a female bird, snake, insect etc

sentences.english: I was cold, tired, and hungry.
sentences.chinese: 我又冷，又累，又饿。

sentences.english: If you get hungry, there’s some cold chicken in the fridge.
sentences.chinese: 你要是饿了，冰箱里有些冷鸡肉。

sentences.english: Do you still feel hungry?
sentences.chinese: 你还觉得饿吗？

sentences.english: She is hungry for success.
sentences.chinese: 她渴望成功。

detailed_translations.english: wanting to eat something

sentences.english: She spent her life pandering to the wants of her children.
sentences.chinese: 她一生都在设法满足子女的需要。

sentences.english: The gallery closed down for want of funding.
sentences.chinese: 那家画廊由于缺乏资金关闭了。

detailed_translations.english: something that you need or want

sentences.english: He’s gone to get some fish and chips.
sentences.chinese: 他去买炸鱼薯条了。

sentences.english: The film starred Jack Lemmon and Shirley Maclaine.
sentences.chinese: 这部电影由杰克·莱蒙和雪莉·麦克莱恩主演。

sentences.english: We’ve dealt with items one, two, and eleven.
sentences.chinese: 我们已经处理了第一项、第二项和第十一项。

sentences.english: He was tall, dark, and handsome.
sentences.chinese: 他身材高大、皮肤黝黑，相貌英俊。

sentences.english: He plays the guitar and sings folk songs.
sentences.chinese: 他弹吉他唱民歌。

sentences.english: I missed supper and I’m starving!
sentences.chinese: 我没吃晚饭，现在饿极了！

detailed_translations.english: used to join two words, phrases etc referring to things that are related in some way

sentences.english: a carton of orange juice
sentences.chinese: 一纸盒橙汁

sentences.english: A Coke and a tomato juice, please.
sentences.chinese: 请来一杯可乐和一杯番茄汁。

detailed_translations.english: the liquid that comes from fruit and vegetables, or a drink that is made from this

sentences.english: Would you like a cup of tea or coffee?
sentences.chinese: 你想来一杯茶还是咖啡？

sentences.english: Do you take milk and sugar in your tea?
sentences.chinese: 你的茶里面要放牛奶和糖吗？

sentences.english: I’d like two teas and a piece of chocolate cake, please.
sentences.chinese: 我想要两杯茶和一块巧克力蛋糕。

detailed_translations.english: a hot brown drink made by pouring boiling water onto the dried leaves from a particular Asian bush, or a cup of this drink

sentences.english: a bottle of milk
sentences.chinese: 一瓶奶

sentences.english: Would you like some milk in your tea?
sentences.chinese: 你茶里要加点奶吗？

sentences.english: a pint of semi-skimmed milk
sentences.chinese: 一品脱半脱脂奶

sentences.english: I helped to milk the cows.
sentences.chinese: 我帮忙挤牛奶。

detailed_translations.english: a white liquid produced by cows or goats that is drunk by people
to take milk from a cow or goat

sentences.english: There’s water all over the bathroom floor.
sentences.chinese: 浴室地面上都是水。

sentences.english: Does anyone want a drink of water?
sentences.chinese: 有谁想喝杯水吗？

sentences.english: a glass of sparkling mineral water
sentences.chinese: 一杯有气矿泉水

sentences.english: All rooms have hot and cold running water.
sentences.chinese: 所有房间都有冷热自来水供应。

sentences.english: Pour boiling water over the rice and let it soak.
sentences.chinese: 在大米中倒入沸水浸泡。

sentences.english: a fresh water spring
sentences.chinese: 淡水泉

sentences.english: When dealing with a burst pipe, always turn off the water first.
sentences.chinese: 处理破裂水管时，一定要先把水关掉。

sentences.english: contamination of the local water supply
sentences.chinese: 当地供水受到污染

sentences.english: Will you water my houseplants while I’m away?
sentences.chinese: 我不在时你能给我家里的盆栽浇浇水吗？

sentences.english: The garden needs watering daily.
sentences.chinese: 花园每天都需要浇水。

detailed_translations.english: the clear liquid without colour, smell, or taste that falls as rain and that is used for drinking, washing etc
if you water plants or the ground they are growing in, you pour water on them

sentences.english: Can I have a glass of water? I’m really thirsty.
sentences.chinese: 我能喝一杯水吗？ 我太渴了。

sentences.english: He’d been working in the garden and was very hot and thirsty.
sentences.chinese: 他一直在花园里干活，又热又渴。

sentences.english: All this digging is thirsty work (= work that makes you want a drink ) .
sentences.chinese: 这种挖地的活干了让人口渴。

detailed_translations.chinese: 口渴的，口干的；渴望的，热望的
detailed_translations.english: feeling that you want or need a drink

sentences.english: Joe got up and left without a word of thanks .
sentences.chinese: 乔起身离开了，一句感谢的话也没有说。

sentences.english: ‘Pass the salt, please…thanks.’
sentences.chinese: “请把盐递过来…谢谢。”

detailed_translations.english: used to tell someone that you are grateful for something they have given you or done for you
the things you say or do to show that you are grateful to someone

sentences.english: I have to wear a shirt and tie to work.
sentences.chinese: 我上班要穿衬衫打领带。

sentences.english: a check shirt
sentences.chinese: 格子衬衫

detailed_translations.english: a piece of clothing that covers the upper part of your body and your arms, usually has a collar, and is fastened at the front by buttons

name: T-shirt
trans: T 恤衫；短袖圆领汗衫

sentences.english: She was wearing jeans and a T-shirt.
sentences.chinese: 她穿着牛仔裤和T恤衫。

detailed_translations.english: a soft shirt with short  sleeves  and no collar

sentences.english: She wore a white blouse and a plain black skirt.
sentences.chinese: 她穿着白衬衣和纯黑的裙子。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of outer clothing worn by women and girls, which hangs down from the waist like the bottom part of a dress
to avoid talking about an important subject, especially because it is difficult or embarrassing – used to show disapproval

sentences.english: a gentleman in evening dress
sentences.chinese: 穿晚礼服的绅士

sentences.english: The play was performed in modern dress (= clothes from the present time ) .
sentences.chinese: 这出戏里演员是现代装束。

detailed_translations.english: clothes for men or women of a particular type or for a particular occasion

sentences.english: ...a pair of knee-high socks.
sentences.chinese: …一双齐膝的短袜。

detailed_translations.english: Socks are pieces of clothing which cover your foot and ankle and are worn inside shoes

sentences.english: I like your shorts, Jake.
sentences.chinese: 杰克， 我喜欢你的短裤。

sentences.english: Where are my shorts?
sentences.chinese: 我的短裤在哪里？

sentences.english: Now I have a cool pair of shorts for riding.
sentences.chinese: 现在我就有了一条骑车时的酷酷短裤啦！

detailed_translations.english: trousers reaching the top of the thigh or partway to the knee, worn by both sexes for sport, relaxing in summer, etc

sentences.english: You should keep in with your colleagues.
sentences.chinese: 你应当与你的同事友好相处。

sentences.english: You should not deprecate your own worth.
sentences.chinese: 你不应该贬低你自己的价值。
